metadata.title: CVE-2020-15570 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The parse_report() function in whoopsie.c in Whoopsie through 0.2.69mishandles memory allocation failures, which allows an attacker to cause adenial of service via a malformed crash file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15570` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwhoopsie0 - 0.2.69ubuntu0.1
whoopsie - 0.2.69ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: whoopsie package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.69ubuntu0.1').
